clinical_study.brief_title: Add-on Buprenorphine at Analgesic Doses for the Treatment of Severe Suicidal Ideas During a Major Depressive Episode
clinical_study.official_title: Add-on Buprenorphine at Analgesic Doses for the Treatment of Severe Suicidal Ideas During a Major Depressive Episode

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims at investigating if adjunctive buprenorphine at low dose to treatment as usual is effective in reducing severe suicidal ideas in major depressive episode, and at determining the most effective dose.

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants will be randomized to two doses of buprenorphine (0.4mg and 0.8mg) or placebo. The duration of treatment will be 21 days with 7 days withdrawal period. Two follow-up phone calls at 3 and 6 months will investigate occurence of suicidal behavior.
The main outcome will be changes in suicidal ideas levels during the first week.
Secondary outcomes will be changes in suicidal ideas during the following 21 days, changes in depression and psychological pain levels over the first 28 days, dropout rates, reasons and occurence of side effects over the first 28 days, withdrawal symptoms dung the withdrawal period, changes in neuropsychological and neuroimaging measures between Day 0 and Day 28.
Blood and stool samples will be collected at 4 time points and stored in a biobank for future analyses.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Beck Scale for Suicidal Ideation (SSI) scores from Day 0 to 7
primary_outcome.description: Clinician-based questionnaire measuring level of suicidal ideas over the last 7 days; 21 items scored 0 to 2; total score ranges from 0 to 38 (last 2 items not counted), higher scores mean more intense suicidal ideas.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Beck Scale for Suicidal Ideation (SSI) scores
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician-based questionnaire measuring level of suicidal ideas over the last 7 days; 21 items scored 0 to 2; total score ranges from 0 to 38 (last 2 items not counted); higher scores mean more intense suicidal ideas.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI-II) scores from Day 0 to 28
secondary_outcome.description: Self questionnaire measuring depression level over the last 7 days; 13 items scored 0 to 3, with the total score ranging from 0 to 39; higher scores mean higher level of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) from Day 0 to 28
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician-based questionnaire measuring the level of depression of the last 7 days; 10 items score 0 to 6, with the total scores ranging fron 0 to 60; Higher scores mean higher level of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physical and Psychological Pain - Visual Analog Scale (PPP-VAS) scores from Day 0 to 28
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analog Scale measuring physical then psychological pain over 3 periods each (current, worst over the last 7 days, mean over the last 7 days); 6 dimensions in total; each dimension is scored from 0 (no pain) to 10 (maximal pain).

secondary_outcome.measure: Reasons for discontinuing treatment over the first 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's self-report; measurement will be the overall (over 28 days) incidence for each event reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Side effects over the first 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's self-report; measurement will be the overall (over 28 days) incidence for each event reported.
Patient's self-report; measurement will be the incidence of any withdrawal symptom during the withdrawal phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurence of a suicide attempt during the whole study
secondary_outcome.description: Interview based; measurement will be the incidence of any suicide attempt between Day 0 and 28, between Day 29 and 90, and between Day 90 and 180.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Iowa Gambling Task (IGT) scores between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Computerized test measuring decision-making; scores are the difference between advantageous and disadvantageous choices; scores range from -100 to + 100, higher scores means better performance

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in modified Stroop test scores between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Classical Stroop test modified with suicide-related words to measure specific attention bias; scores are the number of errors and total reaction time; higher scores mean worse performance

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in verbal fluency test scores between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Classical test measuring verbal fluency skills for semantic and phonological categories; Patients are instructed to give as many words as possible for a given category then for words starting with a given letter, within a 1 minute time frame; Scores are the number of correct words; higher scores mean higher performance

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in N-Back test scores between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Classical test of working memory using letters; scores are the number of words correctly identified for each level of recall (0 to 2 back); higher scores mean better performance; also, the number of omission and commission errors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Go/No-Go test between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Classical test of cognitive inhibition, letter version; scores are the number of omission and commission errors (higher scores mean worse performance) and reaction times (higher scores mean better performance)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Trail Making Test (TMT) scores between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Classical test of planning abilities; scores are the difference between the time to complete parts B and A of the test; Higher scores mean worse performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Implicit Association Test (IAT) scores between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: IAT version adapted for suicide/death; scores are the measure of reaction times in the association between suicide/death words and me/myself words; lower scores mean higher association.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) T1 measures between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Brain structural MRI-T1 sequence measured at Day 0 and Day 28 (5 minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) T2 measures between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Brain structural MRI-T2 sequence measured at Day 0 and Day 28 (5 minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) measures between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Brain Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) sequence measured at Day 0 and Day 28 (20 minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Resting State (RS) measures between Day 0 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Brain functional Resting State (RS) sequence measured at Day 0 and Day 28 (15 minutes)

arm_group.description: 1 pill of 0.4 mg buprenorphine + 1 placebo pill per day for 21 days, then 2 placebo pills per day for 1 week, all sublingual.

1 pill of 0.4 mg buprenorphine + 1 placebo pill per day for 3 days, then 2 pills of 0.4mg buprenorphine per day for 18 days, then 1 pill of 0.4 mg + 1 placebo pill per day for 3 days, then 2 placebo pills per day for 4 days, all sublingual.

intervention.description: Placebo pills, sublingual, specifically made to mimick buprenorphine pills
